articles.title: Debating a National Tribute for Brigitte Bardot in France
articles.summary: In France, right-wing politician Éric Ciotti has proposed a national tribute to honor film icon Brigitte Bardot, who died at 91. Ciotti, leader of the UDR party, launched a petition that garnered over 23,000 signatures, arguing that Bardot brought international fame to France and advocated for women's liberty and abortion rights. He referenced her role as Marianne, a symbol of French liberty in the 1960s. However, Socialist leader Olivier Faure opposes the idea, stating that national homages should be reserved for exceptional services to the nation and noting that Bardot was convicted five times for inciting racial hatred. Bardot's legacy includes starring in about 50 films, such as 'And God Created Woman,' and later dedicating her life to animal welfare after retiring in 1973. She lived in Saint-Tropez and became known for far-right sympathies, with remarks targeting Muslims and others. President Emmanuel Macron praised her as a 'legend of the century,' while Green MP Sandrine Rousseau criticized her for caring about dolphins but not migrants. The debate highlights differing views on her contributions versus her controversies, with comparisons to other national tributes like those for Robert Badinter and Johnny Hallyday.

articles.title: Honoring Contributions: MBE Awards and Social Impact in North-West England
articles.summary: Sally Lindsay, a former Coronation Street actress, has been awarded an MBE in the King's New Years Honours List for her services to drama. At 52, she is best known for her role as Shelley Unwin and expressed deep honor, dedicating the award to working class actors, noting that only 8% of the industry comes from such backgrounds. She hopes this recognition will inspire more diversity in acting. Additionally, Lindsay serves as an ambassador for Demelza Hospice Care, supporting children with serious conditions. The list also includes Bernard Morgan, a 101-year-old World War Two veteran awarded an MBE for volunteering and historical contributions, such as his work at the Imperial War Museum since 2006. Bev Craig, leader of Manchester City Council, received an OBE for her services to local government, including roles during the Covid-19 pandemic. This article showcases how individuals from various fields are recognized for their impactful work, emphasizing themes of representation and community service.

articles.title: Cynthia Erivo's Path to MBE: From Childhood Performances to EGOT Pursuit
articles.summary: Cynthia Erivo, a renowned British actress and singer, has been awarded an MBE in the New Year Honours list for her contributions to music and drama, capping off a successful year. Her career began early with a solo performance in a nativity play at age five, where she realized the impact of her voice. She continued acting in youth productions, such as a musical version of The Caucasian Chalk Circle at 11 and Romeo and Juliet at 15, though she initially doubted a professional future. Now, Erivo stars in the film Wicked: For Good, earning her fifth Golden Globe nomination and potentially a fourth Oscar nod. She has already won a Grammy, daytime Emmy, and Tony, placing her one Oscar away from achieving EGOT status—a rare feat in entertainment. Notably, Erivo accomplished this without industry or family connections, as her parents immigrated from Nigeria and her father cut contact during her teens. Raised by her nurse mother in Stockwell, London, she used her talent to prove her worth and overcome personal challenges. This article highlights her resilience, artistic dedication, and the significance of her honors in recognizing diverse achievements in the arts.

articles.title: Gold Catalyst Achieves Record Performance in Sustainable Chemical Production
articles.summary: Researchers have developed a novel gold catalyst that sets a new benchmark in green chemistry by efficiently converting bioethanol to acetaldehyde. Acetaldehyde is a crucial industrial chemical used in plastics and pharmaceuticals, traditionally produced via the ethylene-based Wacker oxidation process, which is costly and environmentally harmful. The new catalyst, Au/LaMn0.75Cu0.25O3, uses a perovskite support with optimized manganese and copper ratios to enhance performance. It achieves a 95% acetaldehyde yield at 225°C, outperforming the previous record held by an Au/MgCuCr2O4 catalyst that required 250°C. Additionally, it remains stable for 80 hours, demonstrating improved efficiency and lower energy requirements. The breakthrough involves a synergistic interaction between gold nanoparticles and doped perovskite structures, facilitated by computational studies like density functional theory. This advancement addresses long-standing challenges in catalyst design, where increased activity often reduces selectivity, and aims to promote sustainable manufacturing practices by leveraging renewable bioethanol sources.

articles.title: Beyoncé's Billionaire Status and Music Empire
articles.summary: Forbes has officially declared Beyoncé a billionaire, placing her as the fifth musician to achieve this financial milestone. This recognition follows years of substantial earnings from various ventures, including her highly successful Renaissance World Tour, which grossed nearly $600 million, and the Cowboy Carter tour, which added over $400 million in ticket sales and $50 million in merchandise. Beyoncé's strategic business moves, such as distributing her concert film directly through AMC theaters—earning her nearly half of the $44 million global box office—and securing lucrative deals like a Netflix halftime show and Levi's commercials, have significantly boosted her wealth. Her album Cowboy Carter, which won a Grammy Award for album of the year, further cemented her cultural impact. Despite challenges like slow ticket sales for some shows, with promoters reducing prices, the tour set record prices in the UK, with top tickets at £950. Forbes' assessment contrasts with other estimates, such as Bloomberg's inclusion of Selena Gomez as a billionaire, which Forbes disputes. This article underscores Beyoncé's evolution from a pop icon to a savvy entrepreneur, leveraging her music and brand to build a billion-dollar empire.

articles.title: MIT Engineers Develop High-Strength 3D-Printed Aluminum Alloy
articles.summary: MIT engineers have developed a new aluminum alloy that is five times stronger than conventional aluminum and can be produced through 3D printing. This material tolerates extreme heat and matches the strength of top aluminum alloys made by traditional methods. The alloy was created by combining aluminum with other elements, using a process that integrates computer simulations and machine learning to efficiently identify the optimal recipe from millions of possibilities. This approach reduced the search from over 1 million combinations to just 40 promising options. The breakthrough has significant industrial potential, enabling lighter, stronger, and more heat-resistant components, such as fan blades for jet engines, which could replace heavier titanium and save energy in transportation. The project originated from an MIT course where students attempted to design a printable aluminum alloy, but initial simulations fell short. Later, machine learning tools were applied to analyze elemental properties and uncover nonlinear relationships, leading to this successful design. Researchers highlight applications beyond aviation, including advanced vacuum pumps, high-end automobiles, and cooling devices for data centers, due to 3D printing's ability to create complex geometries and save material.
